text: the sight of dead animals is now an
alarmingly common feature of the
Mongolian landscape
Mongolia is rugged and sparsely
populated or the third of its 2.9
million people rely on hurting for their
livelihood but a drought last summer
followed by unusually cold winter has
killed more than 8 million animals goats
she yaks cows horses and camels nearly
twenty percent of the country's
livestock as the snow and cold weather
continued into the last week officials
expected another half million animals
had died before the rains arrive and the
grass returns the disaster is called a
zoo officials fear will force some
20,000 herders to the capital city
looking for work there they will join
thousands of other former herders who
stocks were decimated by previous suits
many will end up unemployed us people
don't know what to do next they're in a
state of shock so that the governor of
the hardest hit area said the die-off
was the most calamitous in 40 years monk
bot loc Vasudha and was only able to
save 200 of the 1200 animals in his
flock I tried everything I could to save
them I failed my girl with them but it
was really freezing cold during the
winter and we couldn't do anything he
couldn't fight with nature make it all
seems to to reduce the potential for
disease as the weather warms the united
nations development program has begun
paying devastated herders about seventy
dollars to collect and bury carcasses so
far more than four million have been
gathered to mass graves experts question
whether over grazing and climate change
will increase chances of future suits
and threatening way of life in Mongolia
I'm also tester will quickly I feel lost
without my animals I'd like to revive my
herd but I don't have any money to buy
more animals I thought about doing a job
but I don't have a skill anyway it
doesn't matter because there aren't any
jobs around here
